Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Secret Garden" (1911) by Agnes of Cook Street.

This classic spy movie features a young girl named Fanny whose family is living in poverty. When Fanny's father falls ill and has to be hospitalized, Fanny is sent away to live with wealthy uncle Sir Thomas, her wife and their four children, where she'll be brought up for a proper introduction to society.

The story follows Fanny as she learns about the ways of the wealthy and how they go about bringing people up into society. Throughout the movie, Fanny faces many challenges and obstacles, but with the help of Sir Thomas, her wife and their four children, Fanny is able to overcome these challenges and obstacles and achieve success in her endeavors.

The movie features a talented cast including: Agnes of Cook Street (Fanny), Julia Butler Harris (Lady Thomas), Richard E. Grant (Mr. Thomas), Andrew Tiernay (Sir Thomas), David Thewlis (General Butler), Harry Shearer (President Hoover), Harry Hamlin (President Roosevelt), and many more.

Overall, "The Secret Garden" is a classic spy movie that features a talented cast including: Agnes of Cook Street (Fanny), Julia Butler Harris (Lady Thomas), Richard E. Grant (Mr. Thomas), Andrew Tiernay (Sir Thomas), David Thewlis (General Butler), Harry Shearer (President Hoover), Harry Hamlin (President Roosevelt), and many more.

The movie has a runtime of 78 minutes and is available on DVD and Blu-ray formats from various sources such as Amazon, Walmart, Best Buy, etc.
